006 package de.general.json;
007 
008 /**
009  *
010  * @author knauth
011  */
012 public class JUtils
013 {
014 
015     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
016     // Constants
017     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
018 
019     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
020     // Variables
021     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
022 
023     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
024     // Constructors
025     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
026 
027     /**
028      * Constructor.
029      */
030     private JUtils()
031     {
032     }
033 
034     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
035     // Methods
036     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
037 
038     public static boolean isValidPath(String path)
039     {
040         if (!path.startsWith("/")) return false;
041         if (path.endsWith("/")) return false;
042         return true;
043     }
044 
045     private static String[] splitPath(String path)
046     {
047         isValidPathE(path);
048 
049         String[] ret = path.substring(1).split("/");
050         return ret;
051     }
052 
053     public static void isValidPathE(String path)
054     {
055         if (!path.startsWith("/")) throw new RuntimeException("Not a valid path!");
056         if (path.endsWith("/")) throw new RuntimeException("Not a valid path!");
057     }
058 
059     /**
060      * This method returns an array of Strings representing the information stored at the specified path within
061      * the specified object. If the element specified by path is a string value it will be returned as an array of one
062      * element in size. If the element specified by path is an JArray of string values the data is converted to a string
063      * array and returned. In all other cases either <code>null</code> is returned or an exception is thrown.
064      *
065      * @param   obj     The object data is to be retrieved from
066      * @param   path    A path to a node within the specified object, f.e. "/some/element/at/some/leaf"
067      * @return  Returns <code>null</code> if the property does not exist or has no string data.
068      */
069     public static String[] getStrArrayByPath(JObject obj, String path)
070     {
071         String[] pathElements = splitPath(path);
072 
073         JObject current = obj;
074         for (int i = 0; i < pathElements.length - 1; i++) {
075             JProperty p = current.getProperty(pathElements[i]);
076             if (p == null) return null;
077             if (p.value instanceof JObject) {
078                 current = (JObject)(p.value);
079             } else {
080                 return null;
081             }
082         }
083 
084         JProperty p2 = current.getProperty(pathElements[pathElements.length - 1]);
085         if (p2 == null) return null;
086 
087         JToken t = p2.getValue();
088         if (t instanceof JValue) {
089             JValue v = (JValue)t;
090             if (v.getValue() instanceof String) {
091                 return new String[] { (String)(v.getValue()) };
092             } else {
093                 return null;
094             }
095         } else
096         if (t instanceof JArray) {
097 
098             JArray a = (JArray)t;
099 
100             String[] ret = new String[a.getCount()];
101             for (int i = 0; i < a.getCount(); i++) {
102                 JToken t2 = a.get(i);
103                 if (t2 instanceof JValue) {
104                     JValue v = (JValue)t2;
105 
106                     if (v.getValue() instanceof String) {
107                         ret[i] = (String)(v.getValue());
108                     } else {
109                         throw new RuntimeException("Array value at index " + i + " not of type String!");
110                     }
111                 } else {
112                     throw new RuntimeException("Array element at index " + i + " not of type JValue!");
113                 }
114             }
115             return ret;
116 
117         } else {
118             return null;
119         }
120     }
121 
122 }
